text: Looks like DMC 3 got Dante's interpretation of Cerberus and the third circle of Hell more accurately than the actual game based off Dante's Inferno. I mean, the latter got it pretty close, but they must have missed the part where it was stated circle #3's super cold, while DMC 3 looks like it didn't miss that part at all!

text: Ahhhhhhhhhhh what a throwback to a great series!
author: Vaseem Baig

text:
I will go on record and say that this is one of the best action games of the past 15 years. Yes, bias plays a good amount in my saying as much, but the game's mechanics, atmosphere, pacing, characters, and execution were all top-notch for their time and remain a joy to play through to this day. (And it's still just as challenging.)

Oh, and it was hugely influential for its time, too. Games like God of War, Bayonetta, and even Bloodborne have to give a lot of credit to Devil May Cry for their success, as they largely ape off of its formula and frenetic pacing.

I fucking love this game.
author: Anony Mous

text: Well Said!
author: Vaseem Baig

text: @Q-Prime, So what? Everyone has different tastes. Just because, for example, someone likes metal music doesn't mean they don't also like folk, or classical music. I know it's been years and it's useless to write but now you're just judging because it doesn't matches yout tastes -.-
author: fr801

text: Supra, sometimes your taste in games gets a bit too dark for me. What ever happened to the music from mario 64 and such? Sure it's a good tune, but sheesh. 4/10 of your songs are 8-bit, and of the rest 3/10 are kinda dark... not to mention 1/20 is a complete WTF was that? (skullmonkeys a little back up the list for example.) I dunno man... I dunno.
author: Q-Prime

text: Adding to fr801's response, I listen to pretty much everything (except most pop, rap/hip hop and hardcore stuff) depending on my mood. Once it's eerie, once it's harder, sometimes I prefer cheerful music. Keep your mind open and try different things, might as well indulge in the emotions various genres bring instead of complaining about a personal list of someone else.
